result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon F Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AS OF 3/26/2015:

Restitution as follows: (Total $909.96) $15.00 to Diane A., Michael B - no amount, $175.00 to Jenna S. and $719.96 to Randal Stokely. Court sets restitution hearing as Michael G., American Family Insurance and Emily R. To be paid as a Condition of Probation - joint and severally.

Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by the agent.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent including drug treatment needs.
No contact with any victims or co-actors.
Provide DNA sample if not provided already.
Case 14CF1106 was dismissed and read into: 14CF735.

Defendant Brandon F Evans in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 8.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 7, 9, 10, 11 and 12 dismissed and read-in. Court will set a restitution hearing as to Michael G., American Family Insurance and Emily R.. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 8:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 18 months) - consecutive  - Stayed for 3 years Probation - consecutive
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation
- Restitution of $15.00 to Diane A., Michael B. (No amount indicated),  $175.00 to Jenna S. and $719.96 to Randal Stokely (See Restitution Summary Attached)  to be paid as a Condition of Probation jointly and severally. Court sets a restitution hearing as to Michael G. and American Family Insurance and Emily R..
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent including drug treatment needs.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No contact with any victims or co-actors.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 -  120 days jail with huber - consecutive to any other sentence -  Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing forthwith. Last 60 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agent's discretion.

REFUND BAIL TO PERSON WHO POSTED IT.
